text: The Day of Yahweh is Near
Blow \add the\add* trumpet\f + \fr 2:1 \ft Hebrew “shofar” \f* in Zion,
and sound the alarm on ⸤my holy mountain⸥!\f + \fr 2:1 \ft Literally “mountain of my holiness” \f*
Let all the inhabitants of the land tremble,
for the day of Yahweh \add is\add* coming
—\add it is\add* indeed near.
A day of darkness and gloom,
a day of cloud and thick darkness,
like the dawn spreads on the mountains,
a great and strong army!
There has been nothing like it from old,
and after it nothing will be again ⸤for generations to come⸥.\f + \fr 2:2 \ft Literally “until years of generations” \f*
⸤Before them⸥\f + \fr 2:3 \ft Literally “before the presence of it” \f* a fire devours,
and behind them a flame burns.
Like the garden of Eden is the land ⸤before them⸥,\f + \fr 2:3 \ft Literally “before the presence of it” \f*
and after them \add it is like\add* a desolate desert,
and nothing can escape them.
Like \add the\add* appearance of horses is their appearance,
and like horsemen they run;
like \add the\add* sound of chariots on the tops of the mountains, they leap about;
like \add the\add* sound of a flame of fire
devouring stubble;
like a strong army arranged
in rows \add for\add* battle.
⸤From before them⸥\f + \fr 2:6 \ft Or “From in front of it,” or “From the presence of it” \f* nations writhe,
all faces ⸤turn pale⸥.\f + \fr 2:6 \ft Literally “gather paleness” \f*
They run like mighty warriors,\f + \fr 2:7 \ft That is, the “great and strong army” (see 2:2) \f*
they scale the wall like men of war;
each goes on its own way,
and they do not swerve \add from\add* their paths.
They do not jostle ⸤one another⸥;\f + \fr 2:8 \ft Literally “each man his brother” \f*
each goes on its own trail;
and through the falling weapons,\f + \fr 2:8 \ft Hebrew “weapon” \f*
they are not halted.
In the city they rush forth;
on the walls\f + \fr 2:9 \ft Hebrew “wall” \f* they run.
Into the houses they climb up;
through the windows
they enter like \add a\add* thief.
⸤Before them⸥\f + \fr 2:10 \ft Literally “Before the presence of it” \f* \add the\add* earth quakes;
\add the\add* heavens tremble;
\add the\add* sun and \add the\add* moon grow dark,
and \add the\add* stars ⸤have withheld⸥\f + \fr 2:10 \ft Literally “gathered” \f* their splendor
And Yahweh ⸤utters⸥\f + \fr 2:11 \ft Literally “gives” \f* his voice before his army,
because his encampment \add is\add* very large;
strong \add is the\add* one who carries out his decree,
for great \add is\add* the day of Yahweh
and exceedingly fearful.
Who can endure it?
A Call to Repentance
“And even now,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 2:12 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“return to me with all your heart,
with fasting, and weeping, and wailing.”
Rend your hearts\f + \fr 2:13 \ft Hebrew “heart” \f* and not your garments,
and return to Yahweh your God,
because he \add is\add* gracious and compassionate,
⸤slow to anger⸥\f + \fr 2:13 \ft Or “patient”; literally “long of anger” \f* and great in loyal love,
and relenting from harm.
Who knows \add whether\add* he will turn and relent,
and leave a blessing behind him,
an offering and a libation,
for Yahweh your God?
Blow \add the\add* trumpet\f + \fr 2:15 \ft Hebrew “Shofar” \f* in Zion,
sanctify a fast, call an assembly;
gather \add the\add* people, consecrate \add the\add* assembly;
assemble \add the\add* elders, gather \add the\add* children,
even those \add who are\add* breast-feeding;
let \add the\add* bridegroom come out from his private room,
and \add the\add* bride from her canopy.
Between the colonnade and the altar,
let the priests, the ministers of Yahweh, weep.
And let them say, “Take pity, Yahweh, on your people.
Do not make your inheritance a reproach,
a byword among \add the\add* nations.
Why should they say among the nations,
‘Where \add is\add* their God?’ ”
The Response and Promise of Yahweh
Then Yahweh became jealous for his land
and took pity on his people.
And Yahweh answered and said to his people,
“Look at me, \add I am\add* sending to you
grain, new wine, and olive oil,
and you will be satisfied by it.
I will not give you \add over\add* any more
as a disgrace among the nations.
⸤The northerners⸥\f + \fr 2:20 \ft Or “The northern army” \f*
I will remove from you;
I will drive them to a desert
and desolate land,
its\f + \fr 2:20 \ft That is, the northern army \f* front to the eastern sea,
and its rear into the western sea;
its stench and odor will rise up
because he\f + \fr 2:20 \ft That is, Yahweh (see v. \xt 21 \ft ) \f* has done great things.
Do not fear, \add O\add* land,
rejoice and be glad,
because Yahweh has done great things.
Do not fear, wild animals of \add the\add* field,
because \add the\add* pastures of \add the\add* desert have put forth new green shoots,
because \add the\add* tree has produced its fruit,
\add the\add* fig tree and \add the\add* vine
have yielded their produce.
Be glad, \add O\add* children of Zion,
be glad and rejoice in Yahweh your God,
because he has given for you
the autumn rains for \add your\add* righteousness,\f + \fr 2:23 \ft Or “vindication” \f*
and he has ⸤poured down⸥\f + \fr 2:23 \ft Literally “brought down” \f* for you rainwater,
\add the\add* autumn and spring rains, as before.
The threshing floors will be full \add with\add* grain,
and the vats will overflow
\add with\add* new wine and olive oil.
I will repay you the years
that the locust has eaten,
the hopper, the destroyer, and the cutter,
my mighty troops that I sent against you.
And you will eat abundantly and be satisfied,
and praise the name of Yahweh your God,
who has dealt with you ⸤wondrously⸥.\f + \fr 2:26 \ft Literally “to do a wonder” \f*
My people ⸤will never be ashamed⸥.\f + \fr 2:26 \ft Literally “will forever not be ashamed” \f*
And you will know that I \add am\add* in the midst of Israel,
and I \add am\add* Yahweh,
your God, and there is no \add other\add*.
My people ⸤will never be ashamed again⸥.\f + \fr 2:27 \ft Literally “will forever no longer be ashamed” \f*
Yahweh’s Spirit Poured Out
\f + \fr 2:28 \ft \xt Joel 2:28–32 \ft in the English Bible is 3:1–5 in the Hebrew Bible \f* And it will happen afterward thus:
I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh,
and your sons and your daughters will prophesy,
and your elders will dream dreams;
your young men shall see visions.
And also on the male slaves and on the female slaves,
I will pour out my Spirit in those days.
And I will ⸤set⸥\f + \fr 2:30 \ft Literally “give” \f* wonders in the heavens, and on earth, blood and fire and columns of smoke.
The sun will be changed to darkness, and the moon to blood, before the coming of the great and awesome day of Yahweh.

And it will happen—everyone who calls on the name of Yahweh will be rescued, because on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there will be ⸤those who escape⸥,\f + \fr 2:32 \ft Literally, “an escape” \f* as Yahweh said, and among the survivors whom Yahweh is calling.
